intro: Grindelia hintoniorum, commonly known as Hinton's gumweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Grindelia hintoniorum is often found in habitats such as grasslands and open woodlands.
